input.description:
Type attribute is optional. Default value is VirtualPCNet32
Supported Values: VirtualE1000, VirtualPCNet32, VirtualVmxnet
backing device name: The name of the backing device on the host system

Information about restrictions on removing this device while a virtual machine is running
Takes in boolen value either true or false

Information about restrictions on removing this device while a virtual machine is running
Takes in boolen value either true or false

Information about restrictions on removing this device while a virtual machine is running
Takes in boolen value either true or false

MAC address type.
Valid values for address type are: manual
Statically assigned MAC address: generated
Automatically generated MAC address: assigned
MAC address assigned by VirtualCenter.

MAC address assigned to the virtual network adapter. Clients can set this property to any of the allowed address types. The server might override the specified value for "Generated" or "Assigned" if it does not fall in the right ranges or is determined to be a duplicate.
Indicates whether wake-on-LAN is enabled on this virtual network adapter. Clients can set this property to selectively enable or disable wake-on-LAN.
backing dv switch [optional] The name of distributed virtual switch.
backing dv portgroup [optional] The name of distributed virtual portgroup

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <device-change> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${type}')>0"> <device> <xsl:attribute name="type">${type}</xsl:attribute> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${backing type}')>0"> <backing type="${backing type}"> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device name}') > 0"> <device-name>${device name}</device-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dv switch}') >0 or string-length('${dv portgroup}') >0"> <port> <dv-portgroup>${dv portgroup}</dv-portgroup> <dv-switch>${dv switch}</dv-switch> </port> </xsl:if> </backing> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <backing> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device name}') > 0"> <device-name>${device name}</device-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dv switch}') >0 or string-length('${dv portgroup}') >0"> <port> <dv-portgroup>${dv portgroup}</dv-portgroup> <dv-switch>${dv switch}</dv-switch> </port> </xsl:if> </backing> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <connectable> <start-connected>${start connected}</start-connected> <allow-guest-control>${allow guest control}</allow-guest-control> <connected>${connected}</connected> </connectable> <address-type>${address type}</address-type> <mac-address>${mac address}</mac-address> <wake-on-lan-enabled>${wake on lan enabled}</wake-on-lan-enabled> </device> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <device> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${backing type}')>0"> <backing type="${backing type}"> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device name}') > 0"> <device-name>${device name}</device-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dv switch}') >0 or string-length('${dv portgroup}') >0"> <port> <dv-portgroup>${dv portgroup}</dv-portgroup> <dv-switch>${dv switch}</dv-switch> </port> </xsl:if> </backing> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <backing> <xsl:if test="string-length('${device name}') > 0"> <device-name>${device name}</device-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dv switch}') >0 or string-length('${dv portgroup}') >0"> <port> <dv-portgroup>${dv portgroup}</dv-portgroup> <dv-switch>${dv switch}</dv-switch> </port> </xsl:if> </backing> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <connectable> <start-connected>${start connected}</start-connected> <allow-guest-control>${allow guest control}</allow-guest-control> <connected>${connected}</connected> </connectable> <address-type>${address type}</address-type> <mac-address>${mac address}</mac-address> <wake-on-lan-enabled>${wake on lan enabled}</wake-on-lan-enabled> </device> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </device-change> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
